00070 void
00071 ExprStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00072     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00073         return;
00074 
00075     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00076     if (expr) 
00077         expr->GetValue(ctx);
00078 }

00119 /** Utility routine that emits code to initialize a symbol given an
00120     initializer expression.
00121 
00122     @param lvalue    Memory location of storage for the symbol's data
00123     @param symName   Name of symbol (used in error messages)
00124     @param type      Type of variable being initialized
00125     @param initExpr  Expression for the initializer
00126     @param ctx       FunctionEmitContext to use for generating instructions
00127     @param pos       Source file position of the variable being initialized
00128 */
00129 static void
00130 lInitSymbol(llvm::Value *lvalue, const char *symName, const Type *type, 
00131             Expr *initExpr, FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
00132     if (initExpr == NULL) {
00133         // Initialize things without initializers to the undefined value.
00134         // To auto-initialize everything to zero, replace 'UndefValue' with
00135         // 'NullValue' in the below
00136         const llvm::Type *ltype = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
00137         ctx->StoreInst(llvm::UndefValue::get(ltype), lvalue);
00138         return;
00139     }
00140 
00141     // If the initializer is a straight up expression that isn't an
00142     // ExprList, then we'll see if we can type convert it to the type of
00143     // the variable.
00144     if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr) == NULL) {
00145         Expr *tcInit = initExpr->TypeConv(type, "inititalizer", true);
00146         if (tcInit != NULL) {
00147             llvm::Value *initializerValue = tcInit->GetValue(ctx);
00148             if (initializerValue != NULL)
00149                 // Bingo; store the value in the variable's storage
00150                 ctx->StoreInst(initializerValue, lvalue);
00151             return;
00152         }
00153     }
00154 
00155     // Atomic types can't be initialized with { ... } initializer
00156     // expressions, so print an error and return if that's what we've got
00157     // here..
00158     if (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL) {
00159         if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr) != NULL)
00160             Error(initExpr->pos, "Expression list initializers can't be used for "
00161                   "variable \"%s\' with atomic type \"%s\".", symName,
00162                   type->GetString().c_str());
00163         return;
00164     }
00165 
00166     const ReferenceType *rt = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type);
00167     if (rt) {
00168         if (!Type::Equal(initExpr->GetType(), rt)) {
00169             Error(initExpr->pos, "Initializer for reference type \"%s\" must have same "
00170                   "reference type itself. \"%s\" is incompatible.", 
00171                   rt->GetString().c_str(), initExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
00172             return;
00173         }
00174 
00175         llvm::Value *initializerValue = initExpr->GetValue(ctx);
00176         if (initializerValue)
00177             ctx->StoreInst(initializerValue, lvalue);
00178         return;
00179     }
00180 
00181     // There are two cases for initializing arrays and vectors; either a single
00182     // initializer may be provided (float foo[3] = 0;), in which case all
00183     // of the array elements are initialized to the given value, or an
00184     // initializer list may be provided (float foo[3] = { 1,2,3 }), in
00185     // which case the array elements are initialized with the corresponding
00186     // values.
00187     const SequentialType *seqType = dynamic_cast<const SequentialType *>(type);
00188     if (seqType != NULL) {
00189         ExprList *exprList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr);
00190         if (exprList == NULL) {
00191             // We have single expression; loop over the elements of the
00192             // array/vector and initialize each of them with it
00193             // individually.
00194             for (int i = 0; i < seqType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
00195                 llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i, "offset");
00196                 lInitSymbol(ptr, symName, seqType->GetElementType(), initExpr, 
00197                             ctx, pos);
00198             }
00199         }
00200         else {
00201             // Otherwise make sure that we have the same number of elements
00202             // in the { } initializer expression as we have in the
00203             // array/vector
00204             int nInits = exprList->exprs.size();
00205             if (nInits != seqType->GetElementCount()) {
00206                 const char *actualType = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type) ? 
00207                     "Array" : "Vector";
00208                 Error(initExpr->pos, "%s initializer for variable \"%s\" requires "
00209                       "%d values; %d provided.", actualType, symName, 
00210                       seqType->GetElementCount(), nInits);
00211             }
00212             else {
00213                 // And initialize each of the array/vector elements with
00214                 // the corresponding expression from the ExprList
00215                 for (int i = 0; i < nInits; ++i) {
00216                     llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i, "offset");
00217                     lInitSymbol(ptr, symName, seqType->GetElementType(), 
00218                                 exprList->exprs[i], ctx, pos);
00219                 }
00220             }
00221         }
00222         return;
00223     }
00224 
00225     // Structs can similarly be initialized in one of two ways; either with
00226     // a list of expressions in braces, one expression per struct member,
00227     // or with a single expression that is used to initialize all struct
00228     // members.
00229     const StructType *st = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type);
00230     if (st) {
00231         ExprList *exprList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr);
00232         if (exprList != NULL) {
00233             // The { ... } case; make sure we have the same number of
00234             // expressions in the ExprList as we have struct members
00235             int nInits = exprList->exprs.size();
00236             if (nInits != st->NumElements())
00237                 Error(initExpr->pos, 
00238                       "Initializer for struct \"%s\" requires %d values; %d provided.",
00239                       symName, st->NumElements(), nInits);
00240             else {
00241                 // Initialize each struct member with the corresponding
00242                 // value from the ExprList
00243                 for (int i = 0; i < nInits; ++i) {
00244                     llvm::Value *ep = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i, "structelement");
00245                     lInitSymbol(ep, symName, st->GetMemberType(i), exprList->exprs[i],
00246                                 ctx, pos);
00247                 }
00248             }
00249         }
00250         else if (initExpr->GetType()->IsNumericType() ||
00251                  initExpr->GetType()->IsBoolType()) {
00252             // Otherwise initialize all of the struct elements in turn with
00253             // the initExpr.
00254             for (int i = 0; i < st->NumElements(); ++i) {
00255                 llvm::Value *ep = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i, "structelement");
00256                 lInitSymbol(ep, symName, st->GetMemberType(i), initExpr, ctx, pos);
00257             }
00258         }
00259         else {
00260             Error(initExpr->pos, "Can't assign type \"%s\" to \"%s\".",
00261                   initExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
00262                   st->GetString().c_str());
00263         }
00264         return;
00265     }
00266 
00267     FATAL("Unexpected Type in lInitSymbol()");
00268 }

00270 
00271 void
00272 DeclStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00273     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00274         return;
00275 
00276     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declaration->declarators.size(); ++i) {
00277         Declarator *decl = declaration->declarators[i];
00278         if (!decl || decl->isFunction) 
00279             continue;
00280 
00281         Symbol *sym = decl->sym;
00282         const Type *type = sym->type;
00283         if (!type)
00284             continue;
00285 
00286         // Now that we're in the thick of emitting code, it's easy for us
00287         // to find out the level of nesting of varying control flow we're
00288         // in at this declaration.  So we can finally set that
00289         // Symbol::varyingCFDepth variable.
00290         // @todo It's disgusting to be doing this here.
00291         sym->varyingCFDepth = ctx->VaryingCFDepth();
00292 
00293         ctx->SetDebugPos(sym->pos);
00294 
00295         // If it's an array that was declared without a size but has an
00296         // initializer list, then use the number of elements in the
00297         // initializer list to finally set the array's size.
00298         const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type);
00299         if (at && at->GetElementCount() == 0) {
00300             ExprList *exprList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(decl->initExpr);
00301             if (exprList) {
00302                 ArrayType *t = at->GetSizedArray(exprList->exprs.size());
00303                 assert(t != NULL);
00304                 sym->type = type = t;
00305             }
00306             else {
00307                 Error(sym->pos, "Can't declare an unsized array as a local "
00308                       "variable without providing an initializer expression to "
00309                       "set its size.");
00310                 continue;
00311             }
00312         }
00313 
00314         // References must have initializer expressions as well.
00315         if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type) && decl->initExpr == NULL) {
00316             Error(sym->pos,
00317                   "Must provide initializer for reference-type variable \"%s\".",
00318                   sym->name.c_str());
00319             continue;
00320         }
00321 
00322         const llvm::Type *llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
00323 
00324         if (declaration->declSpecs->storageClass == SC_STATIC) {
00325             // For static variables, we need a compile-time constant value
00326             // for its initializer; if there's no initializer, we use a
00327             // zero value.
00328             llvm::Constant *cinit = NULL;
00329             if (decl->initExpr) {
00330                 cinit = decl->initExpr->GetConstant(type);
00331                 if (!cinit)
00332                     Error(sym->pos, "Initializer for static variable \"%s\" must be a constant.",
00333                           sym->name.c_str());
00334             }
00335             if (!cinit)
00336                 cinit = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
00337 
00338             // Allocate space for the static variable in global scope, so
00339             // that it persists across function calls
00340             sym->storagePtr =
00341                 new llvm::GlobalVariable(*m->module, llvmType, type->IsConstType(),
00342                                          llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage, cinit,
00343                                          llvm::Twine("static.") +
00344                                          llvm::Twine(sym->pos.first_line) + 
00345                                          llvm::Twine(".") + sym->name.c_str());
00346         }
00347         else {
00348             // For non-static variables, allocate storage on the stack
00349             sym->storagePtr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmType, sym->name.c_str());
00350             // And then get it initialized...
00351             lInitSymbol(sym->storagePtr, sym->name.c_str(), type, decl->initExpr,
00352                         ctx, sym->pos);
00353         }
00354 
00355         // Finally, tell the FunctionEmitContext about the variable 
00356         ctx->EmitVariableDebugInfo(sym);
00357     }
00358 }
00359 
00360 
00361 Stmt *
00362 DeclStmt::Optimize() {
00363     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declaration->declarators.size(); ++i) {
00364         Declarator *decl = declaration->declarators[i];
00365         if (decl && decl->initExpr) {
00366             decl->initExpr = decl->initExpr->Optimize();
00367 
00368             // If the variable is const-qualified, after we've optimized
00369             // the initializer expression, see if we have a ConstExpr.  If
00370             // so, save it in Symbol::constValue where it can be used in
00371             // optimizing later expressions that have this symbol in them.
00372             // Note that there are cases where the expression may be
00373             // constant but where we don't have a ConstExpr; an example is
00374             // const arrays--the ConstExpr implementation just can't
00375             // represent an array of values.
00376             //
00377             // All this is fine in terms of the code that's generated in
00378             // the end (LLVM's constant folding stuff is good), but it
00379             // means that the ispc compiler's ability to reason about what
00380             // is definitely a compile-time constant for things like
00381             // computing array sizes from non-trivial expressions is
00382             // consequently limited.
00383             Symbol *sym = decl->sym;
00384             if (sym->type && sym->type->IsConstType() && decl->initExpr && 
00385                 dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(decl->initExpr) == NULL &&
00386                 Type::Equal(decl->initExpr->GetType(), sym->type))
00387                 sym->constValue = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(decl->initExpr);
00388         }
00389     }
00390     return this;
00391 }
00392 
00393 
00394 Stmt *
00395 DeclStmt::TypeCheck() {
00396     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declaration->declarators.size(); ++i) {
00397         Declarator *decl = declaration->declarators[i];
00398         if (!decl || !decl->initExpr)
00399             continue;
00400 
00401         decl->initExpr = decl->initExpr->TypeCheck();
00402         if (!decl->initExpr)
00403             continue;
00404 
00405         // get the right type for stuff like const float foo = 2; so that
00406         // the int->float type conversion is in there and we don't return
00407         // an int as the constValue later...
00408         const Type *type = decl->sym->type;
00409         if (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL) {
00410             // If it's an expr list with an atomic type, we'll later issue
00411             // an error.  Need to leave decl->initExpr as is in that case so it
00412             // is in fact caught later, though.
00413             if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(decl->initExpr) == NULL)
00414                 decl->initExpr = decl->initExpr->TypeConv(type, "initializer");
00415         }
00416     }
00417     return this;
00418 }

00427     printf("\n");
00428 }

00433 
00434 IfStmt::IfStmt(Expr *t, Stmt *ts, Stmt *fs, bool doUnif, SourcePos p) 
00435     : Stmt(p), test(t), trueStmts(ts), falseStmts(fs), 
00436       doCoherentCheck(doUnif && !g->opt.disableCoherentControlFlow) {
00437 }
00438 
00439 
00440 static void
00441 lEmitIfStatements(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, Stmt *stmts, const char *trueOrFalse) {
00442     if (!stmts)
00443         return;
00444 
00445     if (dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmts) == NULL)
00446         ctx->StartScope();
00447     ctx->AddInstrumentationPoint(trueOrFalse);
00448     stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
00449     if (dynamic_cast<const StmtList *>(stmts) == NULL)
00450         ctx->EndScope();
00451 }
00452 
00453 void
00454 IfStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00455     // First check all of the things that might happen due to errors
00456     // earlier in compilation and bail out if needed so that we don't
00457     // dereference NULL pointers in the below...
00458     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00459         return;
00460     if (!test) 
00461         return;
00462     const Type *testType = test->GetType();
00463     if (!testType)
00464         return;
00465 
00466     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00467     bool isUniform = testType->IsUniformType();
00468     if (isUniform) {
00469         ctx->StartUniformIf(ctx->GetMask());
00470         if (doCoherentCheck)
00471             Warning(test->pos, "Uniform condition supplied to cif statement.");
00472 
00473         // 'If' statements with uniform conditions are relatively
00474         // straightforward.  We evaluate the condition and then jump to
00475         // either the 'then' or 'else' clause depending on its value.
00476         llvm::Value *vtest = test->GetValue(ctx);
00477         if (vtest != NULL) {
00478             llvm::BasicBlock *bthen = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("if_then");
00479             llvm::BasicBlock *belse = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("if_else");
00480             llvm::BasicBlock *bexit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("if_exit");
00481 
00482             // Jump to the appropriate basic block based on the value of
00483             // the 'if' test
00484             ctx->BranchInst(bthen, belse, vtest);
00485 
00486             // Emit code for the 'true' case
00487             ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bthen);
00488             lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "true");
00489             if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00490                 ctx->BranchInst(bexit);
00491 
00492             // Emit code for the 'false' case
00493             ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(belse);
00494             lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "false");
00495             if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
00496                 ctx->BranchInst(bexit);
00497 
00498             // Set the active basic block to the newly-created exit block
00499             // so that subsequent emitted code starts there.
00500             ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bexit);
00501         }
00502         ctx->EndIf();
00503     }
00504     else {
00505         // Code for 'If' statemnts with 'varying' conditions can be
00506         // generated in two ways; one takes some care to see if all of the
00507         // active program instances want to follow only the 'true' or
00508         // 'false' cases, and the other always runs both cases but sets the
00509         // mask appropriately.  The first case is handled by the
00510         // IfStmt::emitCoherentTests() call, and the second is handled by
00511         // IfStmt::emitMaskedTrueAndFalse().
00512         llvm::Value *testValue = test->GetValue(ctx);
00513         if (testValue) {
00514             if (doCoherentCheck) 
00515                 emitCoherentTests(ctx, testValue);
00516             else {
00517                 llvm::Value *oldMask = ctx->GetMask();
00518                 ctx->StartVaryingIf(oldMask);
00519                 emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(ctx, oldMask, testValue);
00520                 ctx->EndIf();
00521             }
00522         }
00523     }
00524 }
00525 
00526 
00527 Stmt *
00528 IfStmt::Optimize() {
00529     if (test) 
00530         test = test->Optimize();
00531     if (trueStmts) 
00532         trueStmts = trueStmts->Optimize();
00533     if (falseStmts) 
00534         falseStmts = falseStmts->Optimize();
00535     return this;
00536 }
00537 
00538 
00539 Stmt *IfStmt::TypeCheck() {
00540     if (test) {
00541         test = test->TypeCheck();
00542         if (test) {
00543             const Type *testType = test->GetType();
00544             if (testType) {
00545                 bool isUniform = testType->IsUniformType() && !g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow;
00546                 if (!testType->IsNumericType() && !testType->IsBoolType()) {
00547                     Error(test->pos, "Type \"%s\" can't be converted to boolean for \"if\" test.",
00548                           testType->GetString().c_str());
00549                     return NULL;
00550                 }
00551                 test = new TypeCastExpr(isUniform ? AtomicType::UniformBool : 
00552                                         AtomicType::VaryingBool, 
00553                                         test, test->pos);
00554                 assert(test);
00555             }
00556         }
00557     }
00558     if (trueStmts)
00559         trueStmts = trueStmts->TypeCheck();
00560     if (falseStmts) 
00561         falseStmts = falseStmts->TypeCheck();
00562 
00563     return this;
00564 }
00565 
00566 
00567 void
00568 IfStmt::Print(int indent) const {
00569     printf("%*cIf Stmt %s", indent, ' ', doCoherentCheck ? "DO COHERENT CHECK" : "");
00570     pos.Print();
00571     printf("\n%*cTest: ", indent+4, ' ');
00572     test->Print();
00573     printf("\n");
00574     if (trueStmts) {
00575         printf("%*cTrue:\n", indent+4, ' ');
00576         trueStmts->Print(indent+8);
00577     }
00578     if (falseStmts) {
00579         printf("%*cFalse:\n", indent+4, ' ');
00580         falseStmts->Print(indent+8);
00581     }
00582 }
00583 
00584 
00585 /** Emit code to run both the true and false statements for the if test,
00586     with the mask set appropriately before runnign each one. 
00587 */
00588 void
00589 IfStmt::emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *oldMask, 
00590                                llvm::Value *test) const {
00591     if (trueStmts) {
00592         ctx->MaskAnd(oldMask, test);
00593         lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "if: expr mixed, true statements");
00594         // under varying control flow,, returns can't stop instruction
00595         // emission, so this better be non-NULL...
00596         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()); 
00597     }
00598     if (falseStmts) {
00599         ctx->MaskAndNot(oldMask, test);
00600         lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "if: expr mixed, false statements");
00601         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00602     }
00603 }
00604 
00605 
00606 /** Emit code for an if test that checks the mask and the test values and
00607     tries to be smart about jumping over code that doesn't need to be run.
00608  */
00609 void
00610 IfStmt::emitCoherentTests(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *ltest) const {
00611     llvm::Value *oldMask = ctx->GetMask();
00612     if (oldMask == LLVMMaskAllOn) {
00613         // We can tell that the mask is on statically at compile time; just
00614         // emit code for the 'if test with the mask all on' path
00615         llvm::BasicBlock *bDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_done");
00616         emitMaskAllOn(ctx, ltest, bDone);
00617         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bDone);
00618     }
00619     else {
00620         // We can't tell if the mask going into the if is all on at the
00621         // compile time.  Emit code to check for this and then either run
00622         // the code for the 'all on' or the 'mixed' case depending on the
00623         // mask's value at runtime.
00624         llvm::BasicBlock *bAllOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mask_all");
00625         llvm::BasicBlock *bMixedOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mask_mixed");
00626         llvm::BasicBlock *bDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_done");
00627 
00628         // Jump to either bAllOn or bMixedOn, depending on the mask's value 
00629         llvm::Value *maskAllQ = ctx->All(oldMask);
00630         ctx->BranchInst(bAllOn, bMixedOn, maskAllQ);
00631 
00632         // Emit code for the 'mask all on' case
00633         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bAllOn);
00634         // We start by explicitly storing "all on" into the mask mask.
00635         // Note that this doesn't change its actual value, but doing so
00636         // lets the compiler see what's going on so that subsequent
00637         // optimizations for code emitted here can operate with the
00638         // knowledge that the mask is definitely all on (until it modifies
00639         // the mask itself).
00640         ctx->SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00641         emitMaskAllOn(ctx, ltest, bDone);
00642         
00643         // And emit code for the mixed mask case
00644         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bMixedOn);
00645         emitMaskMixed(ctx, oldMask, ltest, bDone);
00646 
00647         // When done, set the current basic block to the block that the two
00648         // paths above jump to when they're done.
00649         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bDone);
00650     }
00651 }
00652 
00653 
00654 /** Emits code for 'if' tests under the case where we know that the program
00655     mask is all on.
00656  */
00657 void
00658 IfStmt::emitMaskAllOn(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *ltest, 
00659                       llvm::BasicBlock *bDone) const {
00660     // First, check the value of the test.  If it's all on, then we jump to
00661     // a basic block that will only have code for the true case.
00662     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestAll = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_all");
00663     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestNoneCheck = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_none_check");
00664     llvm::Value *testAllQ = ctx->All(ltest);
00665     ctx->BranchInst(bTestAll, bTestNoneCheck, testAllQ);
00666 
00667     // Emit code for the 'test is all true' case
00668     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestAll);
00669     ctx->StartVaryingIf(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00670     lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "if: all on mask, expr all true");
00671     ctx->EndIf();
00672     if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock() != NULL)
00673         // bblock may legitimately be NULL since if there's a return stmt
00674         // or break or continue we can actually jump and end emission since
00675         // we know all of the lanes are following this path...
00676         ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00677 
00678     // The test isn't all true.  Now emit code to determine if it's all
00679     // false, or has mixed values.
00680     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestNoneCheck);
00681     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestNone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_none");
00682     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestMixed = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_mixed");
00683     llvm::Value *testMixedQ = ctx->Any(ltest);
00684     ctx->BranchInst(bTestMixed, bTestNone, testMixedQ);
00685 
00686     // Emit code for the 'test is all false' case
00687     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestNone);
00688     ctx->StartVaryingIf(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00689     lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "if: all on mask, expr all false");
00690     ctx->EndIf();
00691     if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
00692         // bblock may be NULL since if there's a return stmt or break or
00693         // continue we can actually jump or whatever and end emission...
00694         ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00695 
00696     // Finally emit code for the 'mixed true/false' case.  We unavoidably
00697     // need to run both the true and the false statements.
00698     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestMixed);
00699     ctx->StartVaryingIf(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00700     emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(ctx, LLVMMaskAllOn, ltest);
00701     // In this case, return/break/continue isn't allowed to jump and end
00702     // emission.
00703     assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00704     ctx->EndIf();
00705     ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00706 }
00707 
00708 
00709 /** Emits code that checks to see if for all of the lanes where the mask is
00710     on, the test has the value true.
00711  */
00712 static llvm::Value *
00713 lTestMatchesMask(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *test, llvm::Value *mask) {
00714     llvm::Value *testAndMask = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, test,
00715                                                    mask, "test&mask");
00716     return ctx->MasksAllEqual(testAndMask, mask);
00717 }
00718 
00719 
00720 /** Emit code for an 'if' test where the lane mask is known to be mixed
00721     on/off going into it.
00722  */
00723 void
00724 IfStmt::emitMaskMixed(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *oldMask, 
00725                       llvm::Value *ltest, llvm::BasicBlock *bDone) const {
00726     // First, see if, for all of the lanes where the mask is on, if the
00727     // value of the test is on.  (i.e. (test&mask) == mask).  In this case,
00728     // we only need to run the 'true' case code, since the lanes where the
00729     // test was false aren't supposed to be running here anyway.
00730      llvm::Value *testAllEqual = lTestMatchesMask(ctx, ltest, oldMask);
00731     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestAll = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mixed_test_all");
00732     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestAnyCheck = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mixed_test_any_check");
00733     ctx->BranchInst(bTestAll, bTestAnyCheck, testAllEqual);
00734 
00735     // Emit code for the (test&mask)==mask case.  Not only do we only need
00736     // to emit code for the true statements, but we don't need to modify
00737     // the mask's value; it's already correct.
00738     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestAll);
00739     ctx->StartVaryingIf(ctx->GetMask());
00740     lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "cif: all running lanes want just true stmts");
00741     assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00742     ctx->EndIf();
00743     ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00744 
00745     // Next, see if the active lanes only need to run the false case--i.e. if
00746     // (~test & mask) == mask.
00747     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestAnyCheck);
00748     llvm::Value *notTest = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Xor, LLVMMaskAllOn,
00749                                                ltest, "~test");
00750     llvm::Value *notMatchesMask = lTestMatchesMask(ctx, notTest, oldMask);
00751     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestAllNot = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mixed_test_none");
00752     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestMixed = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mixed_test_mixed");
00753     ctx->BranchInst(bTestAllNot, bTestMixed, notMatchesMask);
00754 
00755     // Emit code for the (~test & mask) == mask case.  We only need the
00756     // 'false' statements and again don't need to modify the value of the
00757     // mask.
00758     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestAllNot);
00759     ctx->StartVaryingIf(ctx->GetMask());
00760     lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "cif: all running lanes want just false stmts");
00761     assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00762     ctx->EndIf();
00763     ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00764 
00765     // It's mixed; we need to run both the true and false cases and also do
00766     // mask update stuff.
00767     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestMixed);
00768     ctx->StartVaryingIf(ctx->GetMask());
00769     emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(ctx, oldMask, ltest);
00770     ctx->EndIf();
00771     ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00772 }
00773 
00774 
00775 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00776 // DoStmt
00777 
00778 /** Given a statment, walk through it to see if there is a 'break' or
00779     'continue' statement inside if its children, under varying control
00780     flow.  We need to detect this case for loops since what might otherwise
00781     look like a 'uniform' loop needs to have code emitted to do all of the
00782     lane management stuff if this is the case.
00783  */ 
00784 static bool
00785 lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(Stmt *stmt, bool inVaryingCF = false) {
00786     StmtList *sl;
00787     IfStmt *is;
00788 
00789     if ((sl = dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmt)) != NULL) {
00790         // Recurse through the children statements 
00791         const std::vector<Stmt *> &stmts = sl->GetStatements();
00792         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < stmts.size(); ++i)
00793             if (lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(stmts[i], inVaryingCF))
00794                 return true;
00795     }
00796     else if ((is = dynamic_cast<IfStmt *>(stmt)) != NULL) {
00797         // We've come to an 'if'.  Is the test type varying?  If so, then
00798         // we're under 'varying' control flow when we recurse through the
00799         // true and false statements.
00800         if (is->test != NULL) {
00801             const Type *type = is->test->GetType();
00802             if (type)
00803                 inVaryingCF |= type->IsVaryingType();
00804         }
00805 
00806         if (lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(is->trueStmts, inVaryingCF) ||
00807             lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(is->falseStmts, inVaryingCF))
00808             return true;
00809     }
00810     else if (dynamic_cast<BreakStmt *>(stmt) != NULL) {
00811         if (inVaryingCF)
00812             return true;
00813     }
00814     else if (dynamic_cast<ContinueStmt *>(stmt) != NULL) {
00815         if (inVaryingCF)
00816             return true;
00817     }
00818     // Important: note that we don't recurse into do/for loops here but
00819     // just return false.  For the question of whether a given loop needs
00820     // to do mask management stuff, breaks/continues inside nested loops
00821     // inside of them don't matter.
00822     return false;
00823 }
00824 
00825 
00826 DoStmt::DoStmt(Expr *t, Stmt *s, bool cc, SourcePos p) 
00827     : Stmt(p), testExpr(t), bodyStmts(s), 
00828       doCoherentCheck(cc && !g->opt.disableCoherentControlFlow) {
00829 }
00830 
00831 
00832 void DoStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00833     // Check for things that could be NULL due to earlier errors during
00834     // compilation.
00835     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00836         return;
00837     if (!testExpr || !testExpr->GetType()) 
00838         return;
00839 
00840     bool uniformTest = testExpr->GetType()->IsUniformType();
00841     if (uniformTest && doCoherentCheck)
00842         Warning(pos, "Uniform condition supplied to \"cdo\" statement.");
00843 
00844     llvm::BasicBlock *bloop = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_loop");
00845     llvm::BasicBlock *bexit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_exit");
00846     llvm::BasicBlock *btest = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_test");
00847 
00848     ctx->StartLoop(bexit, btest, uniformTest, ctx->GetMask());
00849 
00850     // Start by jumping into the loop body
00851     ctx->BranchInst(bloop);
00852 
00853     // And now emit code for the loop body
00854     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bloop);
00855     ctx->SetLoopMask(ctx->GetMask());
00856     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00857     // FIXME: in the StmtList::EmitCode() method takes starts/stops a new
00858     // scope around the statements in the list.  So if the body is just a
00859     // single statement (and thus not a statement list), we need a new
00860     // scope, but we don't want two scopes in the StmtList case.
00861     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(bodyStmts))
00862         ctx->StartScope();
00863 
00864     ctx->AddInstrumentationPoint("do loop body");
00865     if (doCoherentCheck && !uniformTest) {
00866         // Check to see if the mask is all on
00867         llvm::BasicBlock *bAllOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_all_on");
00868         llvm::BasicBlock *bMixed = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_mixed");
00869         ctx->BranchIfMaskAll(bAllOn, bMixed);
00870 
00871         // If so, emit code for the 'mask all on' case.  In particular,
00872         // explicitly set the mask to 'all on' (see rationale in
00873         // IfStmt::emitCoherentTests()), and then emit the code for the
00874         // loop body.
00875         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bAllOn);
00876         ctx->SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00877         if (bodyStmts)
00878             bodyStmts->EmitCode(ctx);
00879         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00880         ctx->BranchInst(btest);
00881 
00882         // The mask is mixed.  Just emit the code for the loop body.
00883         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bMixed);
00884         if (bodyStmts)
00885             bodyStmts->EmitCode(ctx);
00886         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00887         ctx->BranchInst(btest);
00888     }
00889     else {
00890         // Otherwise just emit the code for the loop body.  The current
00891         // mask is good.
00892         if (bodyStmts)
00893             bodyStmts->EmitCode(ctx);
00894         if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
00895             ctx->BranchInst(btest);
00896     }
00897     // End the scope we started above, if needed.
00898     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(bodyStmts))
00899         ctx->EndScope();
00900 
00901     // Now emit code for the loop test.
00902     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(btest);
00903     // First, emit code to restore the mask value for any lanes that
00904     // executed a 'continue' during the current loop before we go and emit
00905     // the code for the test.  This is only necessary for varying loops;
00906     // 'uniform' loops just jump when they hit a continue statement and
00907     // don't mess with the mask.
00908     if (!uniformTest)
00909         ctx->RestoreContinuedLanes();
00910     llvm::Value *testValue = testExpr->GetValue(ctx);
00911     if (!testValue)
00912         return;
00913 
00914     if (uniformTest)
00915         // For the uniform case, just jump to the top of the loop or the
00916         // exit basic block depending on the value of the test.
00917         ctx->BranchInst(bloop, bexit, testValue);
00918     else {
00919         // For the varying case, update the mask based on the value of the
00920         // test.  If any program instances still want to be running, jump
00921         // to the top of the loop.  Otherwise, jump out.
00922         llvm::Value *mask = ctx->GetMask();
00923         ctx->MaskAnd(mask, testValue);
00924         ctx->BranchIfMaskAny(bloop, bexit);
00925     }
00926 
00927     // ...and we're done.  Set things up for subsequent code to be emitted
00928     // in the right basic block.
00929     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bexit);
00930     ctx->EndLoop();
00931 }
00932 
00933 
00934 Stmt *
00935 DoStmt::Optimize() {
00936     if (testExpr) 
00937         testExpr = testExpr->Optimize();
00938     if (bodyStmts) 
00939         bodyStmts = bodyStmts->Optimize();
00940     return this;
00941 }
00942 
00943 
00944 Stmt *
00945 DoStmt::TypeCheck() {
00946     if (testExpr) {
00947         testExpr = testExpr->TypeCheck();
00948         if (testExpr) {
00949             const Type *testType = testExpr->GetType();
00950             if (testType) {
00951                 if (!testType->IsNumericType() && !testType->IsBoolType()) {
00952                     Error(testExpr->pos, "Type \"%s\" can't be converted to boolean for \"while\" "
00953                           "test in \"do\" loop.", testExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
00954                     return NULL;
00955                 }
00956 
00957                 // Should the test condition for the loop be uniform or
00958                 // varying?  It can be uniform only if three conditions are
00959                 // met.  First and foremost, the type of the test condition
00960                 // must be uniform.  Second, the user must not have set the
00961                 // dis-optimization option that disables uniform flow
00962                 // control.
00963                 //
00964                 // Thirdly, and most subtlely, there must not be any break
00965                 // or continue statements inside the loop that are within
00966                 // the scope of a 'varying' if statement.  If there are,
00967                 // then we type cast the test to be 'varying', so that the
00968                 // code generated for the loop includes masking stuff, so
00969                 // that we can track which lanes actually want to be
00970                 // running, accounting for breaks/continues.
00971                 bool uniformTest = (testType->IsUniformType() &&
00972                                     !g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow &&
00973                                     !lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(bodyStmts));
00974                 testExpr = new TypeCastExpr(uniformTest ? AtomicType::UniformBool :
00975                                                           AtomicType::VaryingBool,
00976                                             testExpr, testExpr->pos);
00977             }
00978         }
00979     }
00980 
00981     if (bodyStmts) 
00982         bodyStmts = bodyStmts->TypeCheck();
00983     return this;
00984 }
00985 
00986 
00987 void
00988 DoStmt::Print(int indent) const {
00989     printf("%*cDo Stmt", indent, ' ');
00990     pos.Print();
00991     printf(":\n");
00992     printf("%*cTest: ", indent+4, ' ');
00993     if (testExpr) testExpr->Print();
00994     printf("\n");
00995     if (bodyStmts) {
00996         printf("%*cStmts:\n", indent+4, ' ');
00997         bodyStmts->Print(indent+8);
00998     }
00999 }
01000 
01001 
01002 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01003 // ForStmt
01004 
01005 ForStmt::ForStmt(Stmt *i, Expr *t, Stmt *s, Stmt *st, bool cc, SourcePos p) 
01006     : Stmt(p), init(i), test(t), step(s), stmts(st), 
01007       doCoherentCheck(cc && !g->opt.disableCoherentControlFlow) {
01008 }
01009 
01010 
01011 void
01012 ForStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01013     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
01014         return;
01015 
01016     llvm::BasicBlock *btest = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_test");
01017     llvm::BasicBlock *bstep = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_step");
01018     llvm::BasicBlock *bloop = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_loop");
01019     llvm::BasicBlock *bexit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_exit");
01020 
01021     bool uniformTest = test ? test->GetType()->IsUniformType() :
01022         (!g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow &&
01023          !lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(stmts));
01024 
01025     ctx->StartLoop(bexit, bstep, uniformTest, ctx->GetMask());
01026     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01027 
01028     // If we have an initiailizer statement, start by emitting the code for
01029     // it and then jump into the loop test code.  (Also start a new scope
01030     // since the initiailizer may be a declaration statement).
01031     if (init) {
01032         assert(dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(init) == NULL);
01033         ctx->StartScope();
01034         init->EmitCode(ctx);
01035     }
01036     ctx->BranchInst(btest);
01037 
01038     assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
01039 #if 0
01040     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) {
01041         // when does this happen??
01042         if (init)
01043             ctx->EndScope();
01044         ctx->EndLoop();
01045         return;
01046     }
01047 #endif
01048 
01049     // Emit code to get the value of the loop test.  If no test expression
01050     // was provided, just go with a true value.
01051     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(btest);
01052     llvm::Value *ltest = NULL;
01053     if (test) {
01054         ltest = test->GetValue(ctx);
01055         if (!ltest) {
01056             ctx->EndScope();
01057             ctx->EndLoop();
01058             return;
01059         }
01060     }
01061     else
01062         ltest = uniformTest ? LLVMTrue : LLVMBoolVector(true);
01063 
01064     // Now use the test's value.  For a uniform loop, we can either jump to
01065     // the loop body or the loop exit, based on whether it's true or false.
01066     // For a non-uniform loop, we update the mask and jump into the loop if
01067     // any of the mask values are true.
01068     if (uniformTest) {
01069         if (doCoherentCheck)
01070             Warning(pos, "Uniform condition supplied to cfor/cwhile statement.");
01071         assert(ltest->getType() == LLVMTypes::BoolType);
01072         ctx->BranchInst(bloop, bexit, ltest);
01073     }
01074     else {
01075         llvm::Value *mask = ctx->GetMask();
01076         ctx->MaskAnd(mask, ltest);
01077         ctx->BranchIfMaskAny(bloop, bexit);
01078     }
01079 
01080     // On to emitting the code for the loop body.
01081     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bloop);
01082     ctx->SetLoopMask(ctx->GetMask());
01083     ctx->AddInstrumentationPoint("for loop body");
01084     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmts))
01085         ctx->StartScope();
01086 
01087     if (doCoherentCheck && !uniformTest) {
01088         // For 'varying' loops with the coherence check, we start by
01089         // checking to see if the mask is all on, after it has been updated
01090         // based on the value of the test.
01091         llvm::BasicBlock *bAllOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_all_on");
01092         llvm::BasicBlock *bMixed = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_mixed");
01093         ctx->BranchIfMaskAll(bAllOn, bMixed);
01094 
01095         // Emit code for the mask being all on.  Explicitly set the mask to
01096         // be on so that the optimizer can see that it's on (i.e. now that
01097         // the runtime test has passed, make this fact clear for code
01098         // generation at compile time here.)
01099         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bAllOn);
01100         ctx->SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOn);
01101         if (stmts)
01102             stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01103         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
01104         ctx->BranchInst(bstep);
01105 
01106         // Emit code for the mask being mixed.  We should never run the
01107         // loop with the mask all off, based on the BranchIfMaskAny call
01108         // above.
01109         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bMixed);
01110         if (stmts)
01111             stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01112         ctx->BranchInst(bstep);
01113     }
01114     else {
01115         // For both uniform loops and varying loops without the coherence
01116         // check, we know that at least one program instance wants to be
01117         // running the loop, so just emit code for the loop body and jump
01118         // to the loop step code.
01119         if (stmts)
01120             stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01121         if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
01122             ctx->BranchInst(bstep);
01123     }
01124     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmts))
01125         ctx->EndScope();
01126 
01127     // Emit code for the loop step.  First, restore the lane mask of any
01128     // program instances that executed a 'continue' during the previous
01129     // iteration.  Then emit code for the loop step and then jump to the
01130     // test code.
01131     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bstep);
01132     ctx->RestoreContinuedLanes();
01133     if (step)
01134         step->EmitCode(ctx);
01135     ctx->BranchInst(btest);
01136 
01137     // Set the current emission basic block to the loop exit basic block
01138     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bexit);
01139     if (init)
01140         ctx->EndScope();
01141     ctx->EndLoop();
01142 }
01143 
01144 
01145 Stmt *
01146 ForStmt::Optimize() {
01147     if (test) 
01148         test = test->Optimize();
01149     if (init) 
01150         init = init->Optimize();
01151     if (step) 
01152         step = step->Optimize();
01153     if (stmts) 
01154         stmts = stmts->Optimize();
01155     return this;
01156 }
01157 
01158 
01159 Stmt *
01160 ForStmt::TypeCheck() {
01161     if (test) {
01162         test = test->TypeCheck();
01163         if (test) {
01164             const Type *testType = test->GetType();
01165             if (testType) {
01166                 if (!testType->IsNumericType() && !testType->IsBoolType()) {
01167                     Error(test->pos, "Type \"%s\" can't be converted to boolean for for loop test.",
01168                           test->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
01169                     return NULL;
01170                 }
01171 
01172                 // See comments in DoStmt::TypeCheck() regarding
01173                 // 'uniformTest' and the type cast here.
01174                 bool uniformTest = (testType->IsUniformType() &&
01175                                     !g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow &&
01176                                     !lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(stmts));
01177                 test = new TypeCastExpr(uniformTest ? AtomicType::UniformBool :
01178                                                       AtomicType::VaryingBool,
01179                                         test, test->pos);
01180             }
01181         }
01182     }
01183 
01184     if (init) 
01185         init = init->TypeCheck();
01186     if (step) 
01187         step = step->TypeCheck();
01188     if (stmts) 
01189         stmts = stmts->TypeCheck();
01190     return this;
01191 }
01192 
01193 
01194 void
01195 ForStmt::Print(int indent) const {
01196     printf("%*cFor Stmt", indent, ' ');
01197     pos.Print();
01198     printf("\n");
01199     if (init) {
01200         printf("%*cInit:\n", indent+4, ' ');
01201         init->Print(indent+8);
01202     }
01203     if (test) {
01204         printf("%*cTest: ", indent+4, ' ');
01205         test->Print();
01206         printf("\n");
01207     }
01208     if (step) {
01209         printf("%*cStep:\n", indent+4, ' ');
01210         step->Print(indent+8);
01211     }
01212     if (stmts) {
01213         printf("%*cStmts:\n", indent+4, ' ');
01214         stmts->Print(indent+8);
01215     }
01216 }

01342 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01343 // StmtList
01344 
01345 void
01346 StmtList::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01347     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
01348         return;
01349 
01350     ctx->StartScope();
01351     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01352     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < stmts.size(); ++i)
01353         if (stmts[i])
01354             stmts[i]->EmitCode(ctx);
01355     ctx->EndScope();
01356 }
01357

01359 Stmt *
01360 StmtList::Optimize() {
01361     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < stmts.size(); ++i)
01362         if (stmts[i])
01363             stmts[i] = stmts[i]->Optimize();
01364     return this;
01365 }

01371         if (stmts[i])
01372             stmts[i] = stmts[i]->TypeCheck();
01373     return this;

01387 
01388 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01389 // PrintStmt
01390 
01391 PrintStmt::PrintStmt(const std::string &f, Expr *v, SourcePos p) 
01392     : Stmt(p), format(f), values(v) {
01393 }
01394 
01395 /* Because the pointers to values that are passed to __do_print() are all
01396    void *s (and because ispc print() formatting strings statements don't
01397    encode types), we pass along a string to __do_print() where the i'th
01398    character encodes the type of the i'th value to be printed.  Needless to
01399    say, the encoding chosen here and the decoding code in __do_print() need
01400    to agree on the below!
01401  */
01402 static char
01403 lEncodeType(const Type *t) {
01404     if (t == AtomicType::UniformBool)   return 'b';
01405     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingBool)   return 'B';
01406     if (t == AtomicType::UniformInt32)  return 'i';
01407     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingInt32)  return 'I';
01408     if (t == AtomicType::UniformUInt32) return 'u';
01409     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingUInt32) return 'U';
01410     if (t == AtomicType::UniformFloat)  return 'f';
01411     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingFloat)  return 'F';
01412     if (t == AtomicType::UniformInt64)  return 'l';
01413     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingInt64)  return 'L';
01414     if (t == AtomicType::UniformUInt64) return 'v';
01415     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingUInt64) return 'V';
01416     if (t == AtomicType::UniformDouble) return 'd';
01417     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingDouble) return 'D';
01418     else return '\0';
01419 }
01420 
01421 
01422 /** Given an Expr for a value to be printed, emit the code to evaluate the
01423     expression and store the result to alloca'd memory.  Update the
01424     argTypes string with the type encoding for this expression.
01425  */
01426 static llvm::Value *
01427 lProcessPrintArg(Expr *expr, FunctionEmitContext *ctx, std::string &argTypes) {
01428     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
01429     if (type == NULL)
01430         return NULL;
01431 
01432     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type) != NULL) {
01433         expr = new DereferenceExpr(expr, expr->pos);
01434         type = expr->GetType();
01435         if (type == NULL)
01436             return NULL;
01437     }
01438 
01439     char t = lEncodeType(type->GetAsNonConstType());
01440     if (t == '\0') {
01441         Error(expr->pos, "Only atomic types are allowed in print statements; "
01442               "type \"%s\" is illegal.", type->GetString().c_str());
01443         return NULL;
01444     }
01445     else {
01446         argTypes.push_back(t);
01447 
01448         const llvm::Type *llvmExprType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
01449         llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmExprType, "print_arg");
01450         llvm::Value *val = expr->GetValue(ctx);
01451         if (!val)
01452             return NULL;
01453         ctx->StoreInst(val, ptr);
01454 
01455         ptr = ctx->BitCastInst(ptr, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
01456         return ptr;
01457     }
01458 }
01459 
01460 
01461 /* PrintStmt works closely with the __do_print() function implemented in
01462    the stdlib-c.c file.  In particular, the EmitCode() method here needs to
01463    take the arguments passed to it from ispc and generate a valid call to
01464    __do_print() with the information that __do_print() then needs to do the
01465    actual printing work at runtime.
01466  */
01467 void
01468 PrintStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01469     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01470 
01471     // __do_print takes 5 arguments; we'll get them stored in the args[] array
01472     // in the code emitted below
01473     //
01474     // 1. the format string
01475     // 2. a string encoding the types of the values being printed, 
01476     //    one character per value
01477     // 3. the number of running program instances (i.e. the target's
01478     //    vector width)
01479     // 4. the current lane mask
01480     // 5. a pointer to an array of pointers to the values to be printed
01481     llvm::Value *args[5];
01482     std::string argTypes;
01483 
01484     if (values == NULL)
01485         args[4] = NULL;
01486     else {
01487         // Get the values passed to the print() statement evaluated and
01488         // stored in memory so that we set up the array of pointers to them
01489         // for the 5th __do_print() argument
01490         ExprList *elist = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(values);
01491         int nArgs = elist ? elist->exprs.size() : 1;
01492 
01493         // Allocate space for the array of pointers to values to be printed 
01494         const llvm::Type *argPtrArrayType = 
01495             llvm::ArrayType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, nArgs);
01496         llvm::Value *argPtrArray = ctx->AllocaInst(argPtrArrayType,
01497                                                    "print_arg_ptrs");
01498         // Store the array pointer as a void **, which is what __do_print()
01499         // expects
01500         args[4] = ctx->BitCastInst(argPtrArray, 
01501                                    llvm::PointerType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, 0));
01502 
01503         // Now, for each of the arguments, emit code to evaluate its value
01504         // and store the value into alloca'd storage.  Then store the
01505         // pointer to the alloca'd storage into argPtrArray.
01506         if (elist) {
01507             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elist->exprs.size(); ++i) {
01508                 Expr *expr = elist->exprs[i];
01509                 if (!expr)
01510                     return;
01511                 llvm::Value *ptr = lProcessPrintArg(expr, ctx, argTypes);
01512                 if (!ptr)
01513                     return;
01514 
01515                 llvm::Value *arrayPtr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(argPtrArray, 0, i);
01516                 ctx->StoreInst(ptr, arrayPtr);
01517             }
01518         }
01519         else {
01520             llvm::Value *ptr = lProcessPrintArg(values, ctx, argTypes);
01521             if (!ptr)
01522                 return;
01523             llvm::Value *arrayPtr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(argPtrArray, 0, 0);
01524             ctx->StoreInst(ptr, arrayPtr);
01525         }
01526     }
01527 
01528     // Now we can emit code to call __do_print()
01529     llvm::Function *printFunc = m->module->getFunction("__do_print");
01530     assert(printFunc);
01531 
01532     // Set up the rest of the parameters to it
01533     args[0] = ctx->GetStringPtr(format);
01534     args[1] = ctx->GetStringPtr(argTypes);
01535     args[2] = LLVMInt32(g->target.vectorWidth);
01536     args[3] = ctx->LaneMask(ctx->GetMask());
01537     std::vector<llvm::Value *> argVec(&args[0], &args[5]);
01538     ctx->CallInst(printFunc, argVec, "");
01539 }
01540 
01541 
01542 void
01543 PrintStmt::Print(int indent) const {
01544     printf("%*cPrint Stmt (%s)", indent, ' ', format.c_str());
01545 }

01550     if (values) 
01551         values = values->Optimize();
01552     return this;
01553 }
